results.title: Community centres
results.creator_credit: Brian Bergin, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Further Education”.
One of a series of films which deal with the belief that our education should not stop with formal studies at school. Further education centres are located in major centres throughout South Australia. Shows some of the activities undertaken at Victor Harbour.

results.title: Track events
results.creator_credit: George H. Fox, Jan Sadlo and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and technique. It covers track and field events in girls competition such as: sprints, middle-distance and distance running, hurdles and relays

results.title: Field events
results.creator_credit: Jan Ladlo and Associated Film Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and techniques. The field events such as long jump; standing broad jump; high jump; discus; shot put; and javelin are explained.

results.title: Editing
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to editing the newly processed film with examples of the right and wrong way. First extract and discard unwanted material and adjust the general order, then edit to preserve continuity of movement by cutting an action matching action or the use of cut aways; continuity with static subjects and editing to create contrast and impact; importance of tempo.

The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language

results.title: The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture camera use; loading, running off leader and how to avoid fogging; how to keep the camera steady and use of a tripod; panning and common faults to avoid; the use of the zoom and the need for restraint; placing of the camera and avoidance of the jump cut; pitfalls of reverse action and parallax.
results.title_for_label: The Fundamentals of film making - No.2: using the camera

group_siblings.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language

results.title: The Fundamentals of film making. No.1: learning the language
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of film making”.
An introduction to moving picture photography using the written word in an analogy with the completed film: how a succession of single frames, equivalent of a letter in a single word, gives an impression of continuous movement; the definition and examples of a “shot” likening it to a word in a sentence; then the “sequence” equivalent of a paragraph or chapter, depending on length. The purpose terms used and results achieved when camera angles are varied and the camera moved, and the effect of varying the time scale. How to make basic transitions (cut, fade, mix) from shot to shot.

results.title: Physical fitness (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Animation and the singing of light hearted lyrics contrasts the lack of physical activity since machinery has become such a large part of modern life, against the amount of physical activity that was necessary before the event of such machinery. “We have a different style. But we don’t get enough exercise” are part of the lyrics which introduce this program. However, the video ends on a positive and hopeful note, as mankind is re-educated in the improvements possible to ensure health, happiness and quality of life by increasing daily physical activities.
